intro: Verbascum eskisehirensis, commonly known as the Eskisehir mullein, is a flowering plant native to Turkey. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its tall, hairy stems and large, showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, wind-dispersed seeds. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
